title: Elon Musk announces forming of ‘America Party’ in further break from Trump
byline: Multibillionaire tech CEO Elon Musk says he has launched a new US political party called the America Party.

title: Recommendations on admissions to KDU Medical Faculty: Annual admissions to be limited to 150
byline: Recommendations have been submitted by a committee appointed by the Cabinet of Ministers to propose a framework for student admissions to the Faculty of Medicine (FOM) of the General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University (KDU).

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in the Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts today (06), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Three injured in Kosgama shooting
byline: Three individuals, including a young girl, have been injured in a shooting that took place early this morning (06) in Suduwella, Kosgama, police stated.

title: Death toll from Texas floods reaches 43; many still missing
byline: Some 43 people, including 15 children, have been confirmed dead following flash floods in central Texas, authorities said on Saturday as rescuers continued a frantic search for campers, vacationers and residents who were still missing.

title: Israel to send delegation to Qatar for talks on Gaza ceasefire
byline: Israel will send a delegation to Qatar on Sunday for talks on a possible Gaza hostage and ceasefire deal, although Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office said the changes requested by Hamas to a ceasefire proposal were unacceptable.

title: Four arrested at BIA while attempting to smuggle alcohol and cardamom stock worth Rs. 15M
byline: A total of four Sri Lankans have been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) early this morning (06) while attempting to smuggle a stock of alcohol and cardamom worth approximately Rs. 15 million into the country.

title: 12-hour water cut in several areas of Gampaha tomorrow
byline: A 12-hour water cut will be imposed in several areas in the Gampaha District tomorrow (07), the National Water Supply & Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced.

title: Iran supreme leader in first public appearance since Israel war
byline: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has made his first public appearance since the start of Iran’s conflict with Israel, according to state media.

title: Motorcyclist dies in train collision at unprotected railway crossing in Kochchikade
byline: A person has died in an accident that occurred at an unprotected railway crossing on a by-road leading to Lurdu Mawatha in Kochchikade.

title: 457 persons arrested during special police operation in Southern Province
byline: A total of 457 persons have been arrested on charges of various offenses during a special operation conducted in the Galle, Matara and Elpitiya Police Divisions in the Southern Province yesterday (05), police said.

title: Army assists in treatment of injured tusker ‘Bhathiya’
byline: The Sri Lanka Army has assisted in the treatment of the injured wild tusker ‘Bhathiya’, who had been roaming around the Manigama area in Nikaweratiya while recovering from gunshot wounds sustained approximately two months ago.

title: Over 100 schools identified with potential mosquito breeding sites
byline: A total of 121 schools with possible mosquito breeding sites have been identified during the past three days of the Special Mosquito Control Week, which is being conducted island-wide, the National Dengue Control Unit said.

title: BRICS nations to voice ‘serious concerns’ over Trump tariffs during Rio summit
byline: BRICS leaders are set to gather in Rio de Janeiro on Sunday, calling for reform of traditional Western institutions while presenting the bloc as a defender of multilateralism in an increasingly fractured world.

title: Matthew Duckworth named Australia’s next High Commissioner to Sri Lanka
byline: Matthew Duckworth has been named as Australia’s next High Commissioner to Sri Lanka, the Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Australia has announced.

title: Special traffic plan in Borella tomorrow due to Cardinal’s Golden Jubilee event
byline: A special traffic arrangement will be implemented in Borella tomorrow (July 7), police said.

title: Trump says US will start talks with China on TikTok deal this week
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he will start talking to China on Monday or Tuesday about a possible TikTok deal.

title: China’s first Legoland resort packed on opening day despite heatwave
byline: Tourists and residents in Shanghai on Saturday braved sweltering heat for the official opening of China’s first Legoland resort, featuring thousands of structures built with over 85 million Lego bricks.

title: Health Ministry declares National Injury Prevention Week
byline: The Ministry of Health has taken steps to declare a National Injury Prevention Week.

title: State sector employees given training on safe use of data and digital systems
byline: A workshop for subject officers in the Southern Province has been conducted, as part of a series of specialized training workshops aimed at decentralizing the activities of the President’s Fund to the regional level, the PMD said in a statement.

title: Dalai Lama turns 90 and vows to keep defying China for years
byline: The spiritual leader of Tibetan Buddhists, the Dalai Lama, turns 90 today (Jul 6) after a week of celebrations by followers during which he riled China again and spoke about his hope to live beyond 130 and reincarnate after dying.

title: Has AliExpress, Amazon and Temu abandoned Sri Lanka?
byline: E-commerce websites such as AliExpress, Amazon or Temu have not stopped shipping products to Sri Lankan customers as claimed by certain factions, according to Deputy Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Chathuranga Abeysingha.

title: Train schedule on Northern Line amended
byline: The Department of Railways has taken steps to amend train schedules on the Northern Line following requests made by the public.

title: Former Eastern Provincial Councillor K Pushpakumar arrested by CID
byline: Former Eastern Provincial Councillor K. Pushpakumar, alias ‘Iniya Barathi’ an associate of ‘Pillayan’, has been arrested by the CID.

title: Search for missing continues as Texas floods kill 51, including 15 children
byline: Hundreds of rescuers have been deployed to search for people missing in central Texas, after flash floods killed 51 people, including 15 children.

title: Three children drown in lake in Vakarai
byline: Three children, two girls and one boy, between the ages of 10 and 11, have reportedly drowned in a lake in Vakarai, Batticaloa.

title: ‘Healthcare is not just a service. It is a social necessity’ - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that healthcare is not just a service but a social necessity, and that good regulation, like good governance, is ultimately about protecting and promoting that social necessity.

title: IMF provided Sri Lanka with US$1.74 billion so far - official
byline: The Director General of the Department of Fiscal Policy, Kapila Senanayake, stated that the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has so far provided Sri Lanka with a total of US$1.74 billion.

title: Electronic Revenue License System (eRL 2.0) temporarily unavailable
byline: The Information and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka (ICTA) has announced that the Electronic Revenue License system (eRL 2.0) is temporarily unavailable.

title: Navy nabs two in Kalladi seas for smuggling dried sea cucumbers
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy (SLN) has apprehended two individuals for illegally transporting dried sea cucumbers during a special search operation in the Kalladi sea area in Kalpitiya.

title: Ranil’s X post acknowledged: Elon Musk ready to further collaborate with Sri Lanka?
byline: SpaceX founder and CEO Elon Musk has acknowledged and reposted a statement on X (formally twitter) by former President Ranil Wickremesinghe who had indicated his keenness to meet the owner of Starlink satellite internet services and explore further advancements of Sri Lanka’s digital future.

title: Govt to launch pilot project for nutritious meals at state hospitals
byline: A new initiative has been planned to provide high-quality, nutritious, and appetizing meals to inpatients at government hospitals.

title: Govt to establish wildlife hospital and mobile unit for elephant care
byline: Minister of Environment Dr. Dammika Pathirana stated that steps will be taken in the future to establish a wildlife hospital and a mobile medical unit to treat ailing elephants, following an increase in wild elephant shootings.
